intro: Catostemma pubistylum, commonly known as the hairy catostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Catostemma pubistylum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
